lines.text: Had you had a fight recently?
Not a fight, a thing.
...A thing?
Yeah, a thing, don't you have a girlfriend?
Yeah. And what you think is a thing, you can bet your life she thinks is a fight.
Look, he put up a new one. I heard him on Talk Radio. Every month he puts up a new one.
Every 30 days, you could set your watch by it.
He must have loved her very much.
...I do admire his perseverance.
You don't care if she's alive or dead anymore.
Yes I do.
No you don't. You're just scared that without the search you won't know who you are anymore. Who is Jeff Harriman, if he's not the guy looking for Diane Shaver?
I'm not going to know where Diane is tomorrow?
To me, to kill is not the worst thing you can imagine. There is more.
What's this? Wuthering Heights? Denise, is it not sufficent that while you shall be at peace, I shall ride in the torments of hell?
...It's romantic.
If they can put it in a book it's not romantic. Romance has to be secret.

Look, I know you think restoring this cabin is a crazy idea, but what if it's not? What if I'm learning about myself as I go, realizing that if I can do this, I can do anything. So I take a step,I think is this crazy, should I stop?... Then I think, not yet, there's always time to turn back, if I want to so, I take another step... and another... and another... until one day I realize I've crossed that line... and there's no turning back.
I just want to know where Diane is.
Then you'll want to listen. Or the answer will slip right by you.
She's gone, Jeff. She's gone. You may never know how or why, you just have to learn to accept that.
If Diane were here right now, I'd ask you to marry me. But the truth is, if I could turn back the clock to that day at the gas station just once, I would. Just to find out.

It's not good enough. If you ever want to move on with your life, if you ever want to be happy again, if you ever want to really live,then this is your chance! I love you! But I have to know you feel the same, or else I'm gone forever. Let her go, Jeff. Let her go.
I don't need a gun. Your obsession is my weapon.
How many have you had to drink?
One... after another.
Jesus, it's loaded!
Well that's usually the part psychos respond to, honey.

You have reached the home of Jeff Harriman and Jeff Harriman's twisted ego. Rita Baker no longer lives here. She's left Jeff. She's moving out, and she will not be found here again. So don't Iook for me, forever!
I stongly urge you to move your face back to where it was.
How long have you worked here?
Since the Dawn of Man.
The police - they laugh at me. I'm a joke to them.
I'm beginning to see their point.
I just want to know what happened to Diane.
Then you'll want to listen to the story, and you'll want to listen carefully because sometimes the Devil is in the details.
